Hello! I am a \*\*first-year MSc Biostatistics student\*\* and \*\*bioinformatician\*\* with a strong foundation in Health Sciences and statistical methods. My goal is to work in the field of \*\*statistical genomics\*\*, combining my passion for statistical methods with cellular biology. I have \*\*2 years of experience\*\* analyzing high-throughput data using \*\*Python\*\*, \*\*R\*\*, and \*\*Bash\*\*. In my spare time, I like to play Scrabble, watch hockey, practice the saxophone, and play any sport with a racquet.

I also love \*\*teaching\*\*:
[-]{.underline} \*\*6 semesters\*\* as a Teaching Assistant in McMaster's Faculty of Health Sciences.
[-]{.underline} Taught \*\*General Chemistry\*\* in \*\*10 MCAT prep courses\*\* with The Princeton Review.
[-]{.underline} Organized and ran \*\*14 review sessions\*\* for lower-year Health Sciences students.
